Posted By: TheHandyman (10/31/2011 6:54:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: To all the people hating on this card as a crappy token generator: You are completely missing the point. This card was the FIRST token generator. All artifacts had inflated casting costs at this time, since there was tons of color hate spells and wotc thought that being able to put something into any deck was a big premium to its value. And in addition, evasion abilities like flying could frequently be game enders. For its time, this card was something to be feared.
posts.html:
To all the people hating on this card as a crappy token generator: You are completely missing the point. This card was the FIRST token generator. All artifacts had inflated casting costs at this time, since there was tons of color hate spells and wotc thought that being able to put something into any deck was a big premium to its value. And in addition, evasion abilities like flying could frequently be game enders. For its time, this card was something to be feared.

Posted By: Ryjhan (9/26/2012 7:03:16 AM)
Rating:

@Fert12334
That's because this is a 'Mono Artifact' (Look at it's type line). 'Mono' was an old subtype of artifact that inherently required a to use it's ability, so it only had one use per turn (hence the 'Mono'.) Sort of like how the land subtype 'Forest' inherently adds ": Add to your mana pool." to what ever land it's on.

The alternative was 'Poly Artifact' that did not need the and so could be activated multiple times a turn. Pyramids being one of these. And other was 'Continuous Artifact' that needed no activation, but had static or triggered abilities, like Enchantments. One you should be familiar with is Howling Mine, which only recently left Standard. The line on the Mine about only if is untapped on the more recent versions is also something that was part of the Continuous line of artifacts, in that they lost their effect when tapped.
